case_vignette: A 28-year-old primigravid woman is brought to the emergency department after complaining of severe abdominal pain for 3 hours. She has had no prenatal care. There is no leakage of amniotic fluid. Since arrival, she has had 5 contractions in 10 minutes, each lasting 70 to 90 seconds. Pelvic examination shows a closed cervix and a uterus consistent in size with a 38-week gestation. Ultrasound shows a single live intrauterine fetus in a breech presentation consistent with a gestational age of approximately 37 weeks. The amniotic fluid index is 26 and the fetal heart rate is 92/min. The placenta is not detached. She is scheduled for an emergency lower segment transverse cesarean section because of a nonreassuring fetal heart rate. The infant is delivered and APGAR score is noted to be 8 at 1 minute. The doctor soon notices cyanosis of the lips and oral mucosa, which does not resolve when the infant cries. The infant is foaming at the mouth and drooling. He also has an intractable cough.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

Have you had any vomiting or diarrhea?

Have you had any fever or chills?
I haven't had any fever or chills.

There's no mention of changes in my sleep patterns or energy levels in the information provided.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
I haven't had any prenatal care, which suggests I may not have been on any specific medications or supplements.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
There's no information about changes in my diet or lifestyle.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to any new environments?
I haven't mentioned any recent travel or exposure to new environments.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or medical history?
My family and medical history have not been mentioned.
Final Diagnosis: Gastroenteritis.
